required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessing Gene-Environment Interactions in Clinical Presentation of Nevi and Melanoma
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing Gene-Environment Interactions in Clinical Presentation of Nevi and Melanoma

brief_summary.textblock: This research study is designed to better understand the role of genetics, sun-exposure and phenotypic factors in melanoma.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients will have the opportunity to participate in a questionnaire and then they are given the option to participate in substudy A (wear a UV dosimeter, complete questionnaires, and receive feedback based on the UV dosimeter results), subtstudy B (wear a skin patch, participate in a UV photo analysis, answer questionnaires), and/or substudy C (give biological samples via nevi).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Start of study, initial interaction with participants.
primary_outcome.description: A short questionnaire is administered during the clinic visit to assess sun exposure behaviors of melanoma patients. The data gathered from this questionnaire will help identify possible trends in sun exposure behaviors and provide a baseline dataset for future research,

primary_outcome.time_frame: Start of study to end of study, up to 6 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Identify the difference between self-reported sun exposure behavior and actual UV exposure by having patients wear individual dosimeters

primary_outcome.time_frame: Start of study to end of study, up to 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Determine the relationship between UV camera score, skin patch, sun exposure history, and phenotypic evaluation in melanoma patients using a sun exposure questionnaire

primary_outcome.time_frame: Start of study to end of study, up to 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Determine the relationship between UV camera score, skin patch, sun exposure history, and phenotypic evaluation in non-melanoma patients using a sun exposure questionnaire

primary_outcome.time_frame: Start of study to end of study, up to 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Determine the relationship between UV camera score, skin patch, sun exposure history, and phenotypic evaluation in melanoma patients using a UV photography

primary_outcome.time_frame: Start of study to end of study, up to 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Determine the relationship between UV camera score, skin patch, sun exposure history, and phenotypic evaluation in non-melanoma patients using a UV photography

primary_outcome.time_frame: Start of study to end of study, up to 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Determine the relationship between UV camera score, skin patch, sun exposure history, and phenotypic evaluation in melanoma patients using a silicone casts

primary_outcome.time_frame: Start of study to end of study, up to 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Determine the relationship between UV camera score, skin patch, sun exposure history, and phenotypic evaluation in non-melanoma patients using a silicone casts

primary_outcome.time_frame: Start of study to end of study, up to 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Determine the relationship between UV camera score, skin patch, sun exposure history, and phenotypic evaluation in melanoma patients using a SCINEXA exam.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Start of study to end of study, up to 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Determine the relationship between UV camera score, skin patch, sun exposure history, and phenotypic evaluation in non-melanoma patients using a SCINEXA exam.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Start of study to end of study, up to 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Determine whether UV exposure and camera scores correlates with UV signature (somatic) mutations and other tumor-related mutations in clinically benign nevi and primary melanomas using saliva samples, benign nevi, and primary melanomas. Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) will be used to obtain the genetic information from all samples.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of study to end of study, up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Determine self-reported sun exposure behaviors through participant interviews. Questions are related to time spent outside, and what attempts to be sun-safe occurred while outside.

secondary_outcome.measure: Behavioral Intervention and Immediate Follow Up
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will receive a personalized feedback plan and the success of the plan will be measured through individual dosimetry. We will track real time change in sun exposure based on repeat UV dosimetry.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of study to end of study, up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Determine if a relationship exists between the phenotypic attributes of benign nevi through analysis of genomic DNA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of study to end of study, up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Determine if a relationship exists between the phenotypic attributes of benign nevi through analysis of somatic mutations

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of study to end of study, up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Determine if a relationship exists between the phenotypic attributes of benign nevi through analysis of analysis of UV exposure history

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of study to end of study, up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Determine if a relationship exists between the phenotypic attributes of benign nevi through analysis of analysis of UV camera scores with the clinical presentation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of study to end of study, up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Determine if a relationship exists between the phenotypic attributes of primary melanomas through analysis of genomic DNA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of study to end of study, up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Determine if a relationship exists between the phenotypic attributes of primary melanomas through analysis of somatic mutations

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of study to end of study, up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Determine if a relationship exists between the phenotypic attributes of primary melanomas through analysis of UV exposure history

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of study to end of study, up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Determine if a relationship exists between the phenotypic attributes of primary melanomas through analysis of UV camera scores with the clinical presentation

arm_group.description: Evaluate the effectiveness of dosimetry feedback on sun exposure behaviors, attitudes, and awareness in patients diagnosed with melanoma.

Assess the relationships between UV camera score, silicone mold of a skin patch, phenotypic evaluation and sun-exposure behaviors. Technically, this arm is a sub-study that does not involve an intervention. Patients are not receiving an intervention; they are simply providing data to the study team.

Determine the relationship between measures of sun exposure and genomic characteristics of tumors in melanoma patients. Technically, this arm is a sub-study that does not involve an intervention. Patients are not receiving an intervention; they are simply providing data to the study team.

intervention.description: This is a sub-study that involves a behavioral intervention. Participants will wear a UV dosimetry for 3 weeks, return the device and receive feedback. After the feedback, they will re-wear the device for an additional 3 weeks.
Technically, this arm is a sub-study that does not involve an intervention. Patients are not receiving an intervention; they are simply providing data to the study team.
Technically, this arm is a sub-study that does not involve an intervention. Patients are not receiving an intervention; they are simply providing data to the study team.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. > or = 18 years of age
2. Patient at the University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus Cutaneous Oncology Clinic or Dermatology Clinic OR attend the fundraising event of the Colorado Melanoma Foundation
Exclusion Criteria:
1. No exclusion criteria listed
